content:
Diagnosis
	1. Squamous cell carcinoma of floor of mouth with pulmonary metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Pembrolizumab-Cisplatin-5FU combination - 2 cycles completed
	2. Treatment discontinued due to clinical deterioration

	Radiotherapy
	Not delivered due to clinical deterioration

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new pulmonary metastases and local progression

	Current issues
	1. Severe oral pain
	2. Progressive dysphagia
	3. Weight loss
	4. Increasing oxygen requirements

	Summary of consultation
	This 68-year-old gentleman was reviewed today in clinic with his daughter. Unfortunately, he has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. His oral intake has reduced substantially due to progressive dysphagia and severe oral pain, now requiring liquid nutritional supplements. He has lost a further 4kg since last review, bringing total weight loss to 12kg over 3 months.

His performance status has declined from ECOG 1 to ECOG 3, now spending most of the day in bed or chair. He requires 3L/min oxygen via nasal cannulae for new onset breathlessness. Recent CT chest (15 April 2024) shows multiple new bilateral pulmonary metastases and enlargement of primary tumor from 4.2cm to 5.8cm despite two cycles of systemic therapy.

On examination today, there is extension of the primary tumor with new involvement of the anterior tongue. Bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy is unchanged. Chest examination reveals reduced air entry bilaterally with fine crackles at both bases.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT head requested to investigate new onset headaches

	Medication prescribed
	1. Oxycodone modified release increased to 40mg BD
	2. Breakthrough oxycodone 10mg/4hrly PRN
	3. Regular dexamethasone 4mg BD

	Follow up
	1. Urgent palliative care review arranged for tomorrow
	2. Weekly oncology review
	3. Referral to hospital nutrition team completed

	Required GP actions
	1. Please monitor renal function weekly
	2. Consider home oxygen assessment
	3. District nurse referral for support with medications

cancer_timeline.value: Treatment discontinued after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration
CT chest shows multiple new bilateral pulmonary metastases and enlargement of primary tumor from 4.2cm to 5.8cm

patient_facts.value: ECOG 3, spending most of day in bed or chair
Progressive dysphagia requiring liquid nutritional supplements
Extension of primary tumor with new involvement of anterior tongue, bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy unchanged
Reduced air entry bilaterally with fine crackles at both bases

status_updates.value: Advanced oral cavity SCC with new pulmonary metastases. Significant clinical deterioration with declining performance status despite 2 cycles of systemic therapy
Disease progression with enlarging primary tumor and new pulmonary metastases despite systemic therapy
Systemic therapy discontinued due to clinical deterioration, transition to supportive care
Deterioration from ECOG 1 to ECOG 3 with 12kg weight loss over 3 months
Urgent CT head for new onset headaches
Urgent palliative care review tomorrow, weekly oncology review, referral to hospital nutrition team
